<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 613, 91]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will determine the mass of an object.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 104, 148, 122]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 104, 690, 122]]<|/det|>
Carry out the following instructions, referring to Figs. 1.1 and 1.2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 135, 517, 153]]<|/det|>
The spring has already been set up for you.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[228, 165, 725, 422]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[322, 439, 390, 457]]<|/det|>
<pre>Fig. 1.1

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[560, 439, 630, 457]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 470, 180, 489]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 470, 720, 489]]<|/det|>
Measure and record the length \(l_0\) of the spring without any load.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[552, 501, 873, 520]]<|/det|>
\[l_0 = \text{....................................................................}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 532, 181, 551]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 532, 536, 551]]<|/det|>
Suspend the \(100\mathrm{g}\) mass from the spring.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 562, 664, 581]]<|/det|>
Measure and record the stretched length \(l_1\) of the spring.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[552, 593, 875, 612]]<|/det|>
<form>l_1 = .................................................................... [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 625, 181, 644]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 625, 789, 644]]<|/det|>
Calculate the extension \(e_1\) of the spring using the equation \(e_1 = (l_1 - l_0)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[547, 670, 875, 689]]<|/det|>
<form>e_1 = .................................................................... [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 708, 181, 727]]<|/det|>
<label>(iv)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 707, 751, 736]]<|/det|>
Determine a value for \(k\) using the equation \(k = \frac{m}{e_1}\) , where \(m = 100 \text{g}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[557, 787, 785, 806]]<|/det|>
<form>k = ................................ unit ................... [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 505, 92]]<|/det|>
Set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 1.3.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 343, 180, 359]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 342, 873, 376]]<|/det|>
Place the object \(\mathbf{X}\) with its centre at the mark on the metre rule that is \(40.0 \text{cm}\) from the end resting on the bench.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 388, 873, 421]]<|/det|>
Explain briefly how you made sure that the object was in the correct position. You may wish to use a diagram.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[838, 560, 875, 577]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 588, 181, 607]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 588, 581, 607]]<|/det|>
Measure and record the length \(l_{2}\) of the spring.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 618, 870, 640]]<|/det|>
\[l_{2} = \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \quad (1)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 650, 180, 669]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 650, 801, 669]]<|/det|>
Remove the object \(\mathbf{X}\) . Measure and record the new length \(l_{3}\) of the spring.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 680, 870, 700]]<|/det|>
\[l_{3} = \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \quad (2)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 713, 181, 731]]<|/det|>
<label>(iv)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 713, 875, 732]]<|/det|>
Determine the change in the extension \(e_{2}\) for the mass at 40.0cm, where \(e_{2} = (l_{2} - l_{3})\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[547, 758, 870, 777]]<|/det|>
\[e_{2} = \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \quad (3)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 790, 180, 809]]<|/det|>
<label>(v)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 790, 875, 840]]<|/det|>
Calculate the mass \(M\) of the object \(\mathbf{X}\) using your answer to (a)(iv) and (b)(iv) and the equation \(M = k\left(\frac{e_2}{0.40}\right)\).
